alert.note: Alert for Estill; Lee; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Powell, east central Estill and central Lee Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whynot, or near Beattyville, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Patsey, Standing Rock and Leeco around 325 PM EDT. Pilot, See, Cobhill and Fitchburg around 330 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Rogers Chapel, Furnace, Knowlton and Slade. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 32 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
